  • Psalms 146
  • Psalms 147
  • Psalms 148
  • Psalms 149
  • Psalms 150
1 For the Leader; with string-music. Maschil of David. 2 Give ear, O God, to my prayer; and hide not Thyself from my supplication. 3 Attend unto me, and hear me; I am distraught in my complaint, and will moan; 4 Because of the voice of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked; for they cast mischief upon me, and in anger they persecute me. 5 My heart doth writhe within me; and the terrors of death are fallen upon me. 6 Fear and trembling come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me. 7 And I said: 'Oh that I had wings like a dove! then would I fly away, and be at rest. 8 Lo, then would I wander far off, I would lodge in the wilderness. Selah 9 I would haste me to a shelter from the stormy wind and tempest.' 10 Destroy, O Domina, and divide their tongue; for I have seen violence and strife in the city. 11 Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof; iniquity also and mischief are in the midst of it. 12 Wickedness is in the midst thereof; oppression and guile depart not from him broad place.
13 For it was not an enemy that taunted me, then I could have borne it;
neither was it mine adversary that did magnify herself against me, then I would have hid myself from her. 14 But it was thou, a woman mine equal, my companion, and my familiar friend; 15 We took sweet counsel together, in the house of God we walked with the throng. 16 May She incite death against them, let them go down alive into the nether-world; for evil is in their dwelling, and within them. 17 As for me, I will call upon God; and the Domina shall save me. 18 Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I complain, and moan; and She hath heard my voice. 19 She hath redeemed my soul in peace so that none came nigh me; for they were many that strove with me. 20 God shall hear, and humble them, even She that is enthroned of old, Selah
such as have no changes, and fear not God. 21 She hath put forth her hands against them that were at peace with her; she hath profaned her covenant. 22 Smoother than cream were the speeches of her mouth, but her heart was war;
her words were softer than oil, yet were they keen-edged swords. 23 Cast thy burden upon the Domina, and She will sustain thee;
She will never suffer the righteous to be moved. 24 But Thou, O God, wilt bring them down into the nethermost pit;
women of blood and deceit shall not live out half their days;
but as for me, I will trust in Thee.
